data.title: We had a good time despite Bradley who was arrogant and not accommodating
data.text:
The Biker Bar was something fun and different to do in Durham.  Good concept but the guide needs to be more accommodating, laid back and fun.  We had Bradley.  His demeanor from the beginning of the ride was much to be desired.  We understood the rules and adhered to them.  Bradley did not smile the entire time.  When we stopped he stood with his arms crossed like we were bothering him and wasting his time.

I understand that a group that is drinking is probably not the most fun to be around when you are sober, but you ARE the guide.  

From the time we got on the bike until it ended, Bradley acted arrogant, like we were wasting his time, not very friendly nor accommodating.  We understood there were rules and so this review has nothing to do with the rules and following them.

You would think that The Biker Bar could have better guides that will help you enjoy your experience or maybe crack a smile or laugh at any point during the 2 hr ride.

data.title: Besties 40th
data.text: Although she doesn’t  remember much about the evening  she had a great time and so did my husband and I.  A must try.

data.title: Hilarious - bar on wheels; different kind of "driving"
data.text: great group event to see historic downtown or take a moonlite tour of durham - BYOB/BYOW, snacks, etc.  Learn about historic Durham and get some exercise; have done this twice and it's a blast!

data.title: would have been great
data.text:
We should have called ahead but we were hoping there would be a few seats left.  Instead we just showed up and unfortunately the Biker Bar was completely booked for a birthday party.

You have to have at least 10 people to book the mobile bar (seats 14) and your top speed will be 3 - 5 mph.  There is a tour guide that steers and you provide the pedal power).  You also have to sign a liability waver.  Think how much fun this would be for parties or family reunions.  You supply your own drinks and food.

A standard ride is 2 hours and costs $325 (that's only $23 per person at full capacity).  They offer different types of rides.

You can have a tour of historic architectural, historic places, etc.  It's a 2 hour tour for $350.
You can do a pub crawl.  It's a 3 hour tour for $375.
They have a jammin' around the city tour.  It's 2 hours for $325 and an extended 3 hour tour for $375.
There is a 90 minute moonlight ride for $325.
They offer 3 1/2 hour brewery tours for $425 .
If you have a sweet tooth that have a 2 hour coffee, donut, pie tour for $325.
They have a polar ride November - March with hot chocolate or warm cider.  It's a 90 minute tour for $325.
They also have seasonal tours for New Years Eve, Mardi Gras, July 4th parade, Gay Pride Ride, Halloween Ride, Thanksgiving Day ride, etc.

Riders must be 16 years or older.  Check out their website for a complete list of rules and regulations.
